Chord Progression MIDI Lab

Overview

This is the same generator that previously lived inside the Advanced Rhythmic Systems PDF. Moving it here gives the tool the space it deserves: live previews, better documentation, and a direct link you can bookmark. The engine parses plain-text chord progressions, creates proper voicings (triads, sevenths, slash chords, single-note hooks, or even rests via R:duration), and instantly delivers MIDI or nicely formatted PDF lead sheets for your DAW.

Input Syntax Cheat Sheet

  • Separate chords with spaces: Cmaj7 Dm7 G7.
  • Append durations with : in bars, named values (q, dq, wh), or ticks (T192).
  • Add slash chords (F/A), single notes with octaves (C#3), or rests (R:0.5).
  • Change feels fast by requesting fresh progressions from an LLM or your own notes—just paste, tweak, then preview.

Workflow Tips

  1. Set the vibe – Give the tool a short description when prompting your favorite AI assistant (e.g., “deep dub techno pad progression, 16 bars”) and paste the returned chords.
  2. Choose the voicing recipe – Toggle between chords only, chords + bass, or bass alone, and pick the inversion logic (root, smooth, or wide) plus base octave.
  3. Preview + loop – Use the on-page synth to audition the sequence, click any chord button for spot-checking, and fine tune durations or velocity until it grooves with your rhythmic system.
  4. Export deliverables – Click Download MIDI for DAW work, Export PDF for printable charts, or Copy Share URL when you want to send someone else the exact settings.
